REST API Contacts repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶

Creates a new contact for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactModel) – The data for the contact to create.

  • user (User) – The user to create the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The newly created contact.

Return type:

Contact

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

Retrieves a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The contact with the specified ID, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(skip: int, limit: int, first_name: str, last_name: str, email: str, birthdays: int, user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for a specific user with specified pagination parameters or parameters for searching (by first name or last name, or email, or birthdays).

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – The number of contacts to skip.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to return.

  • first_name (str) – The string with which the contact first name begins (search by first name).

  • last_name (str) – The string with which the contact last name begins (search by last name).

  • email (str) – The string with which the contact email begins (search by email).

  • birthdays (int) – The number of days in which the contact’s birthday will be next (search by birthday).

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve contacts for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

Removes a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to remove.

  • user (User) – The user to remove the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The removed contact, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactModel, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

Updates a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • body (ContactModel) – The updated data for the contact.

  • user (User) – The user to update the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated contact, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

Updates the date of birth of a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • body (ContactUpdate) – The updated date of birth for the contact.

  • user (User) – The user to update the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated contact, or None if it does not exist.

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

Sets a variable indicating that the user has confirmed the email.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email of the user.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The function does not return anything; the user data in the database is modified.

Return type:

None

  • password (str) – The updated password for the user.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

None

  • token (str | None) – The updated refresh token for the user.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The function does not return anything; the user data in the database is modified.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

dict

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Provides the server’s response to password reset request.

Parameters:

  • body (RequestEmail) – User email.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – Variable for background tasks(to send a letter to the user).

  • request (Request) – User request to password reset request.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Dict with information about password reset.

dict

async src.routes.contacts.read_contacts(skip: int = 0, limit: int = 20, first_name: str = '', last_name: str = '', email: str = '', birthdays: int = 0, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → list[Contact]¶

Provides the server’s response to request to the list of contacts for a specific user with specified pagination parameters or parameters for searching (by first name or last name, or email, or birthdays).

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – The number of contacts to skip.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to return.

  • first_name (str) – The string with which the contact first name begins (search by first name).

  • last_name (str) – The string with which the contact last name begins (search by last name).

  • email (str) – The string with which the contact email begins (search by email).

  • birthdays (int) – The number of days in which the contact’s birthday will be next (search by birthday).

  • current_user (User) – The user to retrieve contacts for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[Contact]

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶

async create_access_token(data_payload: dict, expires_delta_sec: float | None = None) → str¶

Retrieves the access token.

Parameters:

  • data_payload (dict) – The data for the access token to create.

  • expires_delta_sec (Optional[float] | None) – The time until the token expires in seconds, if not specified, then 15 minutes.

Returns:

The access token.

Return type:

str

create_email_token(data: dict) → str¶

Retrieves the token for email verification.

Parameters:

data (dict) – The data for the token to create.

Returns:

The token.

Return type:

str

async create_refresh_token(data_payload: dict, expires_delta_sec: float | None = None) → str¶

Retrieves the refresh token.

Parameters:

  • data_payload (dict) – The data for the refresh token to create.

  • expires_delta_sec (Optional[float] | None) – The time until the token expires in seconds, if not specified, then 7 days.

Returns:

The refresh token.

Return type:

str

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str) → str¶

Retrieves the email of the user using the refresh token.

Parameters:

refresh_token (str) – The refresh token of the user.

Returns:

The email of the user.

Return type:

str

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → User¶

Retrieves the user using the access token.

:param token:The access token of the user. :type token: str :param db: The database session. :type db: Session :return: The user with the specified access token. :rtype: User

async get_email_from_token(token: str) → str¶

Retrieves the email of the user using the token.

Parameters:

token (str) – The token of the user.

Returns:

The email of the user.

Return type:

str

get_password_hash(password: str) → str¶

Hashes the password, i.e. returns the password in the hashed form from the password in the usual form.

Parameters:

password (str) – The password in the usual form.

Returns:

The password in the hashed form.

Return type:

str

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
verify_password(plain_password: str, hashed_password: str) → bool¶

Verifies the password in the usual form and the password in the hashed form.

Parameters:

  • plain_password (str) – The password in the usual form.

  • hashed_password (str) – The password in the hashed form.

Returns:

True if the verification is successful, otherwise - False.

Return type:

bool

REST API Contacts services Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str) → None¶

Sends a letter to confirm the email.

Parameters:

  • email (EmailStr) – Email where the letter will be sent.

  • username (str) – The username of the user.

  • host (str) – The host to send a letter.

Returns:

The function does not return anything.

Return type:

None

async src.services.email.send_email_reset_password(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str) → None¶

Sends an email to confirm password reset.

Parameters:

  • email (EmailStr) – Email where the letter will be sent.

  • username (str) – The username of the user.

  • host (str) – The host to send a letter.

Returns:

The function does not return anything.

Return type:

None
